alert.note: Alert for Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Denali; Eastern Alaska Range; Middle Tanana Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 6:17PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...High Water on the Tanana River and Tributaries Draining the Alaska Range... High water on the Tanana River and tributaries draining the Alaska Range will continue for the next several days. This includes the Nabesna River, the Delta River, and the Nenana River. The Tanana River has risen to bankfull from Northway to Fairbanks, with minor flooding occuring at low lying areas between Delta Junction to Fairbanks. Minor flooding is possible on the Nenana River near the City of Nenana. Small rivers and creeks in the Denali Park area could see minor flooding through Tuesday as well. Heavy rain that fell over the South Slopes of the Alaska Range from Denali to the Alcan Border the past several days has caused this high water. Another round of heavy rain is expected over the South Slopes of The Alaska Range today through Wednesday. This could cause the Nabesna, Delta, Nenana and Tanana Rivers to continue rising this week, and cause rivers in the Denali area to remain high of possibly flood. Mud and rock slides are possible in along South Slopes of the Alaska Range between Isabel Pass and Denali through Wednesday as well. A Flood Advisory is in effect through Noon Wednesday from Delta Junction to Fairbanks. Please see that product for more details.
